description: Dermatofibroma is a common benign skin growth that usually appears as a small, firm bump on the skin. It is typically harmless and does not require treatment unless it causes symptoms or cosmetic concerns.
possible causes: The exact cause of dermatofibroma is unknown, but it is believed to be a result of an overgrowth of fibrous tissue in the skin in response to minor trauma or irritation.
symptoms: Dermatofibromas are usually asymptomatic, but they may cause itching, tenderness, or changes in color over time.
treatments: In most cases, dermatofibromas do not require treatment. However, if they are bothersome or cosmetically undesirable, they can be removed surgically or through other methods such as cryotherapy or laser therapy.
